job.description: About UsMercedes-Benz Financial Services is a leading captive automotive financial services provider within Daimler Financial Services, which operates in 40 countries as the global financial services arm of Daimler AG. In the U.S., the corporate headquarters for the Americas Region, we operate under the brands of Mercedes-Benz Financial Services and Daimler Truck Financial. In the Americas Region we also have business operations in Canada, Mexico, Argentina and Brazil.To achieve our goal of being the first-choice provider of vehicle financial products and services that support our brands, dealers and customers, we are looking for talented, diverse and inspired people with the skills, experience and innovative spirit to provide a first-class experience at every turn. We are committed to providing a great workplace environment that fosters a culture of openness, support and camaraderie. Our employee programs and benefits are reflective of our values and are designed to promote growth, balance and wellness in many aspects of your career and life. To see other programs and benefits we offer, visit our website at www.mbfs.com.Job OverviewThe responsibility of the Data Architect is to visualize and design an organization's enterprise data management framework. while leveraging the standard services offered by the TAF Partners. With a specialization in Database Management and Business Intelligence, the Data Architect should be capable of building customized data solutions to store and retrieve company information for business partners. The Data Architect orchestrates the use/ consumption of the IT services and engages Technology Domain & Innovation architects on demand for non-standard service requests and projects.Responsibilities Serve business demands of customer units by designing business specific solutions and translating them as standard services fromTAF Partner (solution design only for exceptional cases) (30%) Support the Business Partner Manager and act as a consultant in addressing any Management Informational Systems(MIS) questions related to the services offered by TAF partner. (20%) Orchestrate the use/ consumption of standard services from TAF Partner platform and other IT related services and Optimize new and current database systems (15%) Coordinate with the Data Science department to identify future needs and requirements (15%) Act as interface to Technology Domain & Innovation Architects and Portfolio Management to update the service catalogue (10%)Analyze structural requirements for new software and applications and develop framework to migrate data from legacy systems to new solutions (10%)QualificationsApplicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. at the time of application. Relocation assistance will not be provided for this position.This position requires a minimum of 5+ years of overall work experience.
